III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 5/26/24, Youth A and Youth B were outside trying to
hurt an animal and Staff 1 directed them back to their cottage. The
youths refused and Staff 1 pushed Youth A to the ground and
Youth A hurt his head and right pointer finger. Youth A then
assaulted Staff 1.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 06/03/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 06/03/2024 and
reported they had no additional information.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 06/03/2024. JJ
Worker transported Youth A on 05/30/2024 from the Juvenile
Detention Center (JDC) to the agency. She reported on
05/26/2024 Youth A had assaulted Staff 1 with a skateboard and
was transported by law enforcement to JDC. Youth A told her
Staff 1 pushed him on the ground on 05/28/2024 but she is not
sure Youth A was being truthful because Youth A tries to take the
focus off himself when he gets in trouble. JJ Worker denied having
any concerns for the staff or the agency.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
06/03/2024. FCW met with Youth A on 05/28/2024 and
05/29/2024 and he admitted to assaulting Staff 1 and that Staff 1
was attempting to verbally redirect him away from the groundhog.
Youth A did not report being pushed or hurt by staff. Youth A has
a history of assaulting staff and currently has three pending
charges. She did not have any concerns for the agency.
Director was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Director said there was an
2

incident involving Youth A trying to hurt a baby groundhog in the
garden by the playground. Director reported Supervisor, Staff 1,
and Staff 2, were outside with Youth A and Youth B. Director is
not aware that Staff 1 pushed Youth A. He said Youth A hit Staff 1
with a skateboard, the police were contacted, and Youth A was
transported to JDC.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 13 years old and
has been at the facility for one year. Youth A reported on
05/26/2024 he was outside by the garden with Youth B. He said
Youth B was trying to hurt the baby groundhog and he was trying
to stop Youth B, that’s when Youth B grabbed and pushed him to
the ground. He said Supervisor and Staff 1 intervened and
separated the two youth. Youth A said Staff 1 grabbed his
headphones off and broke them. Youth A admitted he threw his
skateboard at Staff 1, but denied the skateboard hit Staff 1. Youth
A said Staff 1 grabbed him by the neck and pushed him to the
ground. Youth A said he did hurt his finger but denied currently
having any injuries.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B recalled the
incident and said Youth A was trying to hurt the baby groundhog
and staff were trying to redirect him away from the groundhog.
Youth B was trying to move the groundhog away and Youth A
charged at him with a rock. He admitted to pushing Youth A and
Youth A fell. He said staff separated them and that’s when Youth
A threw his skateboard at Staff 1. He denied witnessing Staff 1,
choke, hit or push Youth A. He said Youth A is the one that hit
Staff 1. Youth B reported feeling safe and did not express any
concerns regarding staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care
worker and has been working at the facility for one year. Staff 1
reported on 05/26/2024 Youth A was by the garden area trying to
hurt a baby groundhog. He and Staff 2 attempted several times to
redirect Youth A away from the animal, but Youth A was not
listening. Youth A and Youth B started to argue and push each
other, so he and Staff 2 separated the two youth. Staff 1 said the
two youth seemed to have calmed down, so he turned around and
that’s when Youth A threw his skateboard at Staff 1, hitting him in
the hip. Staff 1 denied choking, hitting, or pushing Youth A. Staff 1
said Youth A had assaulted him.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 witnessed the
incident between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was trying to hurt the baby groundhog and Youth B was trying to
get Youth A away from the animal. Youth A picked up a rock and
tried to hit Youth B and that’s when Youth B pushed Youth A. She
and Staff 1 separated both youths. Youth A threw his headphones
on the ground and threw his skateboard at Staff 1. The Supervisor
immediately contacted law enforcement and Youth A was
transported to JDC. Staff 2 denied Staff 1 choked, pushed, or hit
Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility, on 06/04/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor witnessed the
incident and denied Staff 1 choked or pushed Youth A. She said
Youth A was the one that hit Staff 1 with his skateboard.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 05/26/2024 completed by Staff 1.
Incident report is consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Methodist Intervention Standards and Prohibitions Policy
outlines discipline standards for youth. The facility prohibits
any form of corporal punishment and/or inappropriate
hands-on intervention such as but not limited to; pinching,
spanking, slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling
hair, grabbing, pushing, and threatening gestures.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted with Staff and Youths, there is
insufficient evidence to support the allegations that Staff 1 pushed
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
